topics.body:
"@Twisty":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a32eee63687230976b1e00#post_54a32eee63687230976b1e00
Honestly these sorts of stuff annoys me, because it ignores any and all factors or positive change for the sake of simplifying the world to support a superiority complex; basically this mentality is what happens when teenagers who think they know everything grow up into adults who think they know everything.  "My morals and beliefs are superior to yours cause I know everything in the world", "NO!  My morals and beliefs are superiors to yours cause I know more than you know and I know everything in the world because you don't know everything, but I know everything", "NO!  My morals and beliefs are far greater than anything you can imagine because I have become enlightened!"  You can't really blame anyone for this though, because the realization that every individual person only ever knows a small fraction of all the knowledge collected scares a lot of people when they realize it.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a337976368722a7a950000#post_54a337976368722a7a950000
[bq="gasmaskangel"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a336f36368723c7c1f0300#post_54a336f36368723c7c1f0300
Personally I find that knowledge comforting. Its a way to say "fuck it, I don't know" and knock off for lunch instead of wasting my time trying to come up with an opinion on shit that in no way affects me.[/bq]
Just spitballing here, but considering how many ideologies(no not just talking about religion, but politics and such) preach "we know absolute truth!" the realization that nobody knows absolute truth probably scares the living shit out of people.  If you your entire life follow a group that goes "if you believe in our stuff hard enough you'll know absolute truth as well" and then realize that nobody knows everything that's going to scare the person regardless of what the group's ideologies were.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
